original: @222b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @222b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya dharma dh'a tu garbha bi ba ra na /
analyzed: a'arya dharma dh'a tu garbha bi ba ra na /
translated: ƒÄrya-dharmadhƒÅtugarbhƒÅvivara·πáa

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po'i rnam par 'grel pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po'i rnam par 'grel pa /
translated: ƒÄrya-dharmadhƒÅtugarbhƒÅvivara·πáa

original: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels.

original: chos rnams gang dag rgyus byung de dag ni //üîΩrgyu dang de la 'gog pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: chos rnams gang dag rgyus byung de dag ni // rgyu dang de la 'gog pa gang yin pa //
translated: Those phenomena that arise from causes

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis bka' stsal pa //üîΩde skad gsungs pa'i tshul can dge sbyong che //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis bka' stsal pa // de skad gsungs pa'i tshul can dge sbyong che //
translated: The TathƒÅgata himself has declared

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The one who speaks in this way is a great ascetic.

original: de la chos gang dag ces bya ba ni rnam pa bdun du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la chos gang dag ces bya ba ni rnam pa bdun du shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, those phenomena should be understood as sevenfold:

original: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi rnams so ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi rnams so ;
translated: consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and old age and death.

original: / chos de dag kyang rnam pa lnga las byung ba yin pas rgyus byung ngo //
analyzed: / chos de dag kyang rnam pa lnga las byung ba yin pas rgyus byung ngo //
translated: Those phenomena also arise from five aspects, so they arise from causes.

original: rgyu lnga po de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu lnga po de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are those five causes?

original: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / 'du byed dang srid pa dang lnga'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / 'du byed dang srid pa dang lnga'o //
translated: Ignorance, craving, grasping, compositional activity, and becoming.

original: chos rnam pa bdun dang / de'i rgyu lnga po de dag 'gog pa ni rgyu dang de la 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnam pa bdun dang / de'i rgyu lnga po de dag 'gog pa ni rgyu dang de la 'gog pa ste /
translated: The cessation of these seven phenomena and their five causes is the cessation of their causes.

original: de yang nye bar zhi ba dang / thar pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de yang nye bar zhi ba dang / thar pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: It is also called peace, liberation, and nirvana.

original: de yang su zhig gis bshad ce na /
analyzed: de yang su zhig gis bshad ce na /
translated: Who taught this?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis bka' stsal te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis bka' stsal te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The sutra says, ‚ÄúThe Tathagata himself taught it.‚Äù

original: des bshad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des bshad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that he taught it.

original: don ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du rtogs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: don ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du rtogs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is called the Tathagata because he realized the way things exist just as it is.

original: yang na dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du ma nor bar gzhan la ston par mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du ma nor bar gzhan la ston par mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, he is called the Tathagata because he taught others the way things are without error.

original: de lta bu'i lam ston cing rang nyid kyis rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lam ston cing rang nyid kyis rtogs pa ste /
translated: He is the one who taught this path and realized it himself.

original: thos pa'i dang tshul gang la yod pa de ni de skad gsung ba'i dang tshul can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i dang tshul gang la yod pa de ni de skad gsung ba'i dang tshul can zhes bya'o //
translated: He who has the manner of speaking thus is called one who has the manner of speaking thus.

original: chen po ni gtso bo dang / phul dang / dam pa dang / rab mchog gi don te /
analyzed: chen po ni gtso bo dang / phul dang / dam pa dang / rab mchog gi don te /
translated: Great means chief, best, excellent, and supreme.

original: de yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said:

original: mkhas pa dang / dpa' ba dang / dka' thub can dang / spro ba che ba dang / brtson 'grus drag po dang / rmad du byung ba'i phrin las mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni chen po'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa dang / dpa' ba dang / dka' thub can dang / spro ba che ba dang / brtson 'grus drag po dang / rmad du byung ba'i phrin las mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni chen po'o //
translated: He who is wise, brave, ascetic, greatly enthusiastic, of intense effort, and of wondrous deeds is great.

original: de la shes par bya ba ma lus pa mkhyen pas na mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de la shes par bya ba ma lus pa mkhyen pas na mkhas pa'o //
translated: Among them, he is wise because he knows all that is to be known.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom pas dpa' ba'o /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom pas dpa' ba'o /
translated: He is brave because he has conquered all afflictions.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par bsgoms pas dka' thub pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par bsgoms pas dka' thub pa'o //
translated: He is ascetic because he has cultivated morality well.

original: yon tan la sogs pa la mi skyo bas na spro ba che ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan la sogs pa la mi skyo bas na spro ba che ba'o //
translated: He is greatly enthusiastic because he is not discouraged by qualities and so on.

original: mgo 'am thod la me 'bar ba bzhin du brtson 'grus drag po'o //
analyzed: mgo 'am thod la me 'bar ba bzhin du brtson 'grus drag po'o //
translated: He is of intense effort like a fire burning on his head or skull.

original: rmad du byung ba'i chos mngon sum du mdzad pas na rmad du byung ba'i phrin las can te /
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i chos mngon sum du mdzad pas na rmad du byung ba'i phrin las can te /
translated: Since he has actualized the marvelous Dharma, he has marvelous activity.

original: de lta bu la chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Such a one is called the Great One.

original: dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni sdig pa dang nyon mongs pa nye bar @223a * //üîΩzhi bas dge sbyong ngo //
analyzed: dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni sdig pa dang nyon mongs pa nye bar @223a * // zhi bas dge sbyong ngo //
translated: He is a sramana because he has pacified evil and the afflictions.

original: sdig pa thams cad spangs pas bram ze'o //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad spangs pas bram ze'o //
translated: He is a brahmana because he has abandoned all evil.

original: nyon mongs pas ngal ba sel bas dge sbyong ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas ngal ba sel bas dge sbyong ngo //
translated: He is a sramana because he removes the fatigue of the afflictions.

original: bdag nyid kyi dri ma 'byin pas na rab tu byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dri ma 'byin pas na rab tu byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He is called a renunciate because he removes his own stains.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The Bhagavan, who possesses such qualities, has said this.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path should be applied in the same way.

original: de la rgyu ma rig pa las 'du byed la sogs pa rga shi'i bar du byed pa po med par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de la rgyu ma rig pa las 'du byed la sogs pa rga shi'i bar du byed pa po med par 'byung ba ni /
translated: In this regard, the arising of the twelve factors of dependent origination from ignorance as a cause up to aging and death without an agent

original: lugs las 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: lugs las 'byung ba yin la /
translated: is the natural order.

original: rgyu ma rig pa la sogs pa de dag 'gog pa shes pa lugs las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu ma rig pa la sogs pa de dag 'gog pa shes pa lugs las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The knowledge of the cessation of those causes, such as ignorance, is called the reversal of the order.

original: ma rig pa log pas 'du byed la sogs pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa log pas 'du byed la sogs pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: When ignorance is reversed, the formative forces and so forth do not occur.

original: de ltar gsung ba ni dge sbyong chen po yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gsung ba ni dge sbyong chen po yin no //
translated: The one who teaches this is the Great Monk.

original: 'phags pa chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po'i rnam par 'grel pa slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po'i rnam par 'grel pa slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the essence of the ultimate expanse composed by the master Nagarjuna is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po ye shes snying po dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de dpal brtsegs kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po ye shes snying po dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de dpal brtsegs kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
translated: It was translated, edited, and finalized by the Indian abbot Yeshe Nyingpo and the great editor and translator Bende Pal Tseg.
